intro: Neobrachyactis roylei, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are erect and often branched. Neobrachyactis roylei is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
